## Developer Tools

### Overview

The Developer Tools have been designed to help a team configure a set of popular open source tools that can enable
cloud native development. Typically a squad lead or lead developer install and setup these tools after the
initial inception workshop. The objective of this is to reduce the amount of time a team needs to configure and
prepare their IBM Kubernetes Service, Red Hat OpenShift or Red Hat Code Ready Containers development environments.
The key benefit of this is to make the end to end CI/CD development lifecycle for Kubernetes,OpenShift and CodeReady Containers
consistent across each platform and make the out of the box developer experience and simple as possible.

The installation is managed with Terraform and it enables it to be modular in configuration
so tools can be easily disabled or new tools added. This combination of tools are proven in the
industry to deliver real value for modern cloud native development.

The Red Hat Innovation Lab has a very similar approach to how they deliver success with OpenShift, view their approach [here](https://github.com/rht-labs/labs-ci-cd).

After installation your environment will consist of the following development tools which have been installed into your IBM Kubernetes Service,Red Hat OpenShift and Red Hat CodeReady Containers cluster managed cluster.

- IBM Container Service Cluster (3 nodes) for Kubernetes or OpenShift
- Create *dev*,*test*,*staging* and *tools* namespaces
- Install the following tools:

    - [Jenkins CI](https://jenkins.io/)
    - [Argo CD](https://argoproj.github.io/argo-cd/)
    - [SonarQube](https://www.sonarqube.org/)
    - [Pack Broker](https://docs.pact.io/)
    - [Artifactory](https://jfrog.com/open-source/)
    - [Eclipse CHE](https://www.eclipse.org/che/)


- The following IBM Cloud services will be created and bound to you your development cluster:

    - [AppID Application Authentication](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/appid?topic=appid-service-access-management)
    - [Cloudant NoSQL Database](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/Cloudant?topic=cloudant-getting-started)
    - [Cloud Object Storage Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-getting-started)
    - [LogDNA Logging](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/Log-Analysis-with-LogDNA?topic=LogDNA-getting-started)
    - [SysDig Monitoring](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/Monitoring-with-Sysdig?topic=Sysdig-getting-started)
    - [PostgreSQL](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/services/databases-for-postgresql?topic=databases-for-postgresql-about) (used by SonarQube)
